decks.notes: This deck focuses on controlling the game by using a variety of spells to counter and remove threats from the opponent. The deck has a strong selection of counterspells and removal spells, along with card draw and filtering to ensure consistency in drawing key cards. The presence of planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and creatures like Snapcaster Mage provide additional win conditions and value. The deck also uses cards like Blood Moon to disrupt the opponent's mana base and gain an advantage.

The main concept of this Aggro Death & Taxes deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy while efficiently deploying threats to apply pressure. By utilizing disruptive cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Phyrexian Revoker, alongside mana denial from Wasteland and Rishadan Port, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan. Meanwhile, the deck employs powerful creatures like Stoneforge Mystic and Flickerwisp to establish a clock and close out the game quickly. Overall, this deck aims to disrupt the opponent's resources and tempo while quickly overwhelming them with aggressive threats.

The deck focuses on quickly generating mana and card advantage with its elves, then using powerful spells like Natural Order and Craterhoof Behemoth to win the game in explosive fashion. By efficiently ramping up mana and drawing cards with Glimpse of Nature, the deck can assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to react. With a strong mix of ramp, card draw, and powerful threats, the deck aims to dominate the board and end the game in its favor quickly.

This deck focuses on controlling the game and disrupting the opponent's strategies by using a combination of spells and creatures. With a variety of removal spells, counterspells, and disruptive creatures like Baleful Strix and Leovold, Emissary of Trest, this deck aims to keep the opponent on the back foot while generating card advantage through cards like Snapcaster Mage and Dack Fayden. The deck also utilizes planeswalkers like Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to further control the game state and ultimately secure victory through attrition.

The deck focuses on using Cloudpost lands to generate massive amounts of mana quickly, allowing the player to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Ugin, Emrakul, and Ulamog. The deck also includes cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Chalice of the Void to disrupt the opponent's strategy, while cards like Trinisphere and Voltaic Key help control the pace of the game. Utilizing the ramp provided by Cloudpost lands, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with huge threats and powerful spells, ultimately leading to victory through sheer dominance on the battlefield.

The primary focus of this Grixis Control Legacy deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan through a combination of disruptive spells like Cabal Therapy and Inquisition of Kozilek, efficient creatures like Gurmag Angler and Young Pyromancer, and card selection engines such as Ponder and Brainstorm. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor to further control the game. With a mix of removal, counter spells, and card advantage, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and grind out a win through strategic resource management and board control.

The primary strategy of this deck is to use the card Aluren to continuously loop creatures with low converted mana costs in order to generate value and create a combo win condition. By utilizing creatures like Cavern Harpy and Shardless Agent, the deck aims to create a powerful board presence while controlling the opponent's resources with cards like Deathrite Shaman and Leovold, Emissary of Trest. The inclusion of disruptive spells like Force of Will and Abrupt Decay further enhances the deck's ability to control the game and push towards a victory.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill your graveyard with powerful creatures like Golgari Grave-Troll and Stinkweed Imp using cards like Faithless Looting and Breakthrough. Once your graveyard is full, you can use cards like Bridge from Below and Cabal Therapy to generate an army of tokens and disrupt your opponent's strategy. The deck also includes cards like Ichorid and Narcomoeba to provide additional value from cards being put into the graveyard. This deck relies on fast and explosive plays to overwhelm your opponent and secure victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through various spells and creatures. It utilizes a combination of removal spells, hand disruption, and card advantage engines like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Baleful Strix. The mana base is designed to support a variety of colors for maximum flexibility in spellcasting. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while slowly building up its own resources to eventually take control of the game and secure a victory.

The primary focus of this deck is to quickly drop Death's Shadow, using cards like Gitaxian Probe, Street Wraith, and Thoughtseize to reduce your own life total. Delver of Secrets can provide a quick clock while controlling the opponent's board with counterspells like Force of Will and Stifle. The mana base is designed to support all of these cards, with Wasteland providing disruption against the opponent's mana base. Overall, this deck excels at being aggressive while simultaneously disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on using a combination of hand disruption, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers to control the game and outvalue opponents. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Hymn to Tourach and Thoughtseize, while also generating card advantage with Baleful Strix and Snapcaster Mage. The inclusion of powerful spells like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Kess, Dissident Mage further solidifies the control aspect of the deck. With a diverse mana base, the deck is able to cast its spells efficiently and consistently control the game.

This deck focuses on assembling the powerful Dark Depths combo as quickly and efficiently as possible. The key strategy involves using cards like Crop Rotation, Sylvan Scrying, and Expedition Map to tutor for and play Dark Depths alongside Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token. The deck also includes disruption cards like Duress and Thoughtseize to protect the combo, as well as mana acceleration from Lotus Petal and Elvish Spirit Guide. The goal is to win the game with a massive flying token before the opponent has a chance to respond.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through card advantage, counterspells, and removal spells. It aims to efficiently deal with threats while drawing cards and manipulating the top of the deck with cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Search for Azcanta. The deck also includes win conditions like Entreat the Angels and Swords to Plowshares to maintain board control. With a mix of control elements and card selection, this deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver opponents in a slow, methodical game plan.

The key strategy of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Young Pyromancer, while disrupting their game plan with counter spells like Daze and Force of Will. Magus of the Moon punishes non-basic land decks, while Price of Progress can deal a significant amount of damage unexpectedly. The deck also includes efficient cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm to smooth out draws, along with burn spells like Lightning Bolt to finish off opponents. The mana base includes versatile fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent and efficient casting of spells.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively play out threats like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and Gurmag Angler while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Daze, Stifle, and Force of Will. The deck also includes versatile cards like Deathrite Shaman and True-Name Nemesis to provide additional value and protection. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive game plan with a mix of fetchlands and dual lands. Overall, the goal is to apply early pressure, disrupt the opponent's strategy, and close out the game quickly.
